knimeNode.name: Bounding Box
knimeNode.shortDescription: Calculated a bounding box according to a threshold of pixels in a row/column, uses the centroid to simplify the calculation. The centroid can be calculated using the Image Features node provided in the KNIP (Image Processing) package.

fullDescription.intro: Calculated a bounding box according to a threshold of pixels in a row/column, uses the centroid to simplify the calculation. The centroid can be calculated using the Image Features node provided in the KNIP (Image Processing) package.
fullDescription.option: Return either the original, input image and the calculated boundary box, or, return a modified image which contains the lines which represent the boundary box. Usually this is helpful when debugging. In general, the original return type should be used as its more efficient.

Number of pixels in a row which will be considered to be the boundary. Can either provide a single number, e.g. '150' which will be used for both upper and lower bound, or two separate numbers, e.g. '460,560' meaning '460' will be used for the upper boundary and '560' for the lower one.
Number of pixels in a column which will be considered to be the boundary. Same as row threshold, can provide a single or two thresholds.
